title: Louisiana
content:
Hi,

We have a new font that is being released called Louisiana. An Art Director that I do work for has the most beautiful handwriting I have ever seen. So I asked her if she would like to make a font together and this is what we came up with :)

I had to modify and correct some of the forms to make it work as a font.

We are very pleased with the end result.

-Charles Borges de Oliveira

CBdO

[www.borgeslettering.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031537/http:/www.borgeslettering.com/ "www.borgeslettering.com")

comments.content:
Lovely and flowing - you can just tell it's a feminine hand.

You could do replacement ligatures for duplicate characters together (sunny, Hawaii, Cookies) to make it look more realistic.

Nick Cooke

Thanks guys. Nice suggestion Nick. I had made a bunch of ligatures for this font but fontlab didnt like the new ligatures. Anytime I introduced new kerning to the font I would keep getting an error message when generating the font "causes overflow of offset to a subtable (0x11a00" It was frustrating so I had to bag the new ligatures and just keep the current ones. It is interesting to note that she is left handed which I believe may give to the slight italic slant.  
-Charles

I like the tension between the forwards rounds and the backslant straights, nicely balanced.  
Special!
